snippet: A recently retired Marine wonders what life will be like without the thrill of combat or the agony of taking a human life. But more than anything, he worries about the part of himself that he lost.
abstract: A recently retired Marine wonders what life will be like without the thrill of combat or the agony of taking a human life. But more than anything, he worries about the part of himself that he lost.

headline.main: Ending a Life, and a Part of Yourself, for the First Time
